revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Geniatech |model=Enjoy TV |revision=Nano (ATV310B) |asin=B004YGSHBU |fcc_date=07/31/2012 |manuf_country= |is_manuf=No |manuf= |availability= |type=media player |fcc_id=ZJU-000120010 |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Amlogic |cpu1_model=AML8726 |cpu1_cspeed=800 |fla1=1 GiB |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |ram1=1 GiB |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, SD Card, |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=RF-LINK RL-UM02 |wi1_module_if=USB (non-standard connector) |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8188CUS |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=HDMI out, S-Video out, |tp_firmware=Android |802dot11_protocols=bgn }} {{TagLine|Geniatech Enjoy TV Nano}} :[http://www.geniatech.com/pa/atv310.asp Product page]
*"RM231 VER1.3" or something is silkscreened on the main board. *"RF-LINK" and "RL-UM02-V1.0" is silkscreened on the wireless module.
A heatsink covers the SoC in the FCC photos. :The device probably uses an [[Amlogic]] chip.
*[http://www.amazon.com/MyGica-ATV310B-Android-Player-Ethernet/dp/B0089C5V28 Spec. on '''Amazon'''] :CPU: ARM Cortex A9, 800MHz, 3D engine :Flash Memory Storage: 1GB, RAM: 1GB
The FCC test report lists the following additional models as covered by this FCC ID.. *ATV100 *ATV200 *ATV1200 *ATV510B *ATV1100B *ATV3000B *ATV4000B
